remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Hello, thank you for coming in today. I understand you’ve been experiencing scrotal pain and swelling, as well as a tender papule on the dorsum of your scrotum. Can you tell me more about when these symptoms first began and if you’ve noticed any changes in their severity?

remedi_labels.value: tender papule on the dorsum of scrotum

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, yeah, so... I started having scrotal pain and swelling a couple days ago. It’s been getting worse, I think. I’m just, uh, kind of worried about it.

I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious—scrotal pain and swelling can be very uncomfortable and concerning. You mentioned the pain has been getting worse; have you also noticed any changes in the appearance of your scrotum, such as increased redness, induration, or a tender papule?

remedi_labels.value: changes in the appearance of scrotum

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Yeah, um... I did notice there’s this, like, small bump—maybe that’s the papule you mentioned? And the area looks more red than usual. I’m not sure about induration, but it just feels kind of swollen and pain.

Thank you for describing your symptoms so clearly. You mentioned a small bump and increased redness—these can be important signs. Have you noticed if the redness or swelling has been spreading or if the area has become firmer to the touch, which we call induration?

remedi_labels.value: induration (area has become firmer to the touch)

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um… yeah, I think the redness has been spreading, especially over the left side of my scrotum. It feels kind of firmer there too—so, I guess that’s induration? The bump is about a centimeter, and it’s pretty tender when I touch it. I’m just, uh, getting more anxious because it seems to be getting worse. Should I be worried?

remedi_labels.value: redness spreading over left side of scrotum
induration (firmness) on left side of scrotum

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried—worsening redness, swelling, and tenderness can be concerning symptoms, especially when they assessm to be spreading. To help with my assessment, have you experienced any fever, chills, or other systemic symptoms such as experiencing generally unwell along with these changes in your scrotum?

Yeah, actually… I did have a pretty high fever—like, it went up to 103.3 at one point. And, um, the redness, or erythema I guess, seemed to be spreading really fast, kind of going past where it started. I’ve just been feeling pretty unwell overall. Is that something serious?

Thank you for sharing these details—it’s important that you’ve noticed the redness and induration spreading, along with a high fever. To further guide my assessment, have you observed any drainage, pus, or changes in the skin over the papule or affected area since your symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: changes in the skin over the papule or affected area

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, let me think… Yeah, there was some drainage from the area, kind of like pus, and it looked like it was turning into a scrotal abscess. After I had a procedure for it, my fever went up again—to about 102.4. I’m just, uh, still feeling pretty anxious because it doesn’t seem to be getting better.

I can understand why you’d be anxious, especially with persistent symptoms and recurrent fever after your procedure. To help with my assessment, have you noticed any changes in the size or tenderness of the papule or the area of induration since your last examination?

remedi_labels.value: I can understand why you’d be anxious, especially with persistent symptoms and recurrent fever after your procedure.
changes in the size or tenderness of the papule or the area of induration since last examination

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, actually… since my last exam, the papule seems about the same size, maybe a little more tender. The area of induration feels like it’s spreading a bit, and it’s still pretty firm. I also wanted to mention—um, I’ve had staph abscesses before, like on my head and buttock, so I’m kind of worried this could be something similar.

And lately, I’ve noticed some moderate suprapubic tenderness too. I’m not sure if that’s related, but my lower abdomen feels a bit distended. Should I be concerned that this is all connected?

remedi_labels.value: papule about the same size, more tender
area of induration spreading, still firm
previous staph abscesses on head and buttock

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious, especially given your history of staph abscesses and the new symptoms of suprapubic tenderness and abdominal distension. To help with my assessment, have you experienced any difficulty with urination, changes in urinary frequency, or pain when urinating since these symptoms began?

Um, actually, now that you mention it, I think I have been going to the bathroom a bit more often than usual, and there’s some discomfort when I urinate—not exactly pain, but kind of a burning feeling. I wasn’t sure if it was related, but with the moderate suprapubic tenderness and this abdominal distension I’ve been having, it’s starting to worry me more.

Also, my fever’s still been pretty high—like, the Tmax was 102.4 even after the procedure. I just feel really unwell overall. Is this something that could get worse? Should I be worried about it spreading or turning into something more serious?

remedi_labels.value: should I be worried about it spreading or turning into something more serious

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with ongoing fever, discomfort with urination, and spreading redness and induration in your scrotum. To help with my assessment, have you noticed any new areas of skin breakdown, discoloration, or changes in sensation—such as numbness or increased pain—over the affected area since your last examination?

remedi_labels.value: spreading redness and induration in scrotum
changes in sensation (numbness or increased pain)
